description: Configuration for the Cultural Protocol System - defines protocols for five major cultures

Protocols.Requirements: Precise, non-contradictory sequences. Arguments must follow logical progression without emotional appeals or circular reasoning.
Protocols.ViolationConsequence: Dismissal of argument as irrational. The Dvergr will refuse to engage further until you demonstrate logical competence.

DetailedRequirements.RequirementText: Use precise numerical language when discussing quantities

Protocols.CultureDescription: The Dvergr value precision and logical consistency above all else. Arguments must follow clear reasoning chains, and contradictions are considered either insulting or evidence of poor intellect.
Protocols.ProtocolNarrative: Among the Dvergr, every word is a stone in an argument's foundation. Build carelessly, and the entire structure of your position collapses.

Protocols.Requirements: Layer truth in deception. Direct statements are considered crude and offensive. Wrap your meaning in metaphor and misdirection.
Protocols.ViolationConsequence: Social offense. Direct truth-telling marks you as unsophisticated. -2d10 on future checks with this NPC.

DetailedRequirements.RequirementText: Accept deception as a form of respect

Protocols.CultureDescription: The Utgard believe that only fools and children speak plainly. Proper communication involves layering truth within acceptable deception, demonstrating wit and sophistication.
Protocols.ProtocolNarrative: In Utgard society, the veil between truth and lie is not a barrier but a dance floor. To speak plainly is to stand still while others waltz.

Protocols.Requirements: Listen to the extended greeting rumble. The Gorge-Maw communicate through extended, resonant vocalizations. Interruption is the gravest insult.
Protocols.ViolationConsequence: Perceived arrogance triggers immediate hostility. The Gorge-Maw may attack or refuse all future interaction.

DetailedRequirements.RequirementText: Remain silent during the greeting rumble

Protocols.CultureDescription: The Gorge-Maw consider hospitality sacred. Business cannot be discussed until proper hospitality rites are completed, including shared food, extended greetings, and patient listening.
Protocols.ProtocolNarrative: To the Gorge-Maw, patience is the highest form of respect. The rumble of greeting carries generations of history - to interrupt is to silence ancestors.

Protocols.Requirements: Open mind, suppress hostility. The Rune-Lupin communicate through limited telepathy. Mental barriers or hostile thoughts cause painful feedback.
Protocols.ViolationConsequence: Psychic feedback causes +2 Stress. Repeated violations may result in permanent telepathic block.

DetailedRequirements.RequirementText: Accept emotional impressions from the pack

Protocols.CultureDescription: The Rune-Lupin communicate partially through telepathic impression. Successful interaction requires opening one's mind to their pack telepathy and allowing emotional states to be sensed.
Protocols.ProtocolNarrative: The Rune-Lupin see thoughts as clearly as words. To them, a closed mind is a slammed door - and hostile thoughts are drawn weapons.
SpecialWarnings: Characters with mental shields face significant challenges

Protocols.Requirements: Offer martial tribute first. Before any negotiation, you must demonstrate martial worth through a gift of weapons, armor, or combat prowess.
Protocols.ViolationConsequence: Viewed as weakling unworthy of respect. DC +4 on all checks. May be challenged to prove worth through combat.

DetailedRequirements.RequirementText: Present weapon or armor as gift

Protocols.CultureDescription: The Iron-Bane respect martial achievement. Before serious discussion can occur, visitors must demonstrate their martial status through tribute or by recounting their martial achievements.
Protocols.ProtocolNarrative: Among the Iron-Bane, steel speaks louder than words. An empty hand offers nothing; a blooded blade offers everything.

BloodOathRules.Description: The Iron-Bane seal significant agreements with blood oaths - rituals that bind both parties to their word with supernatural consequences for betrayal.
BloodOathRules.CompletingOathBenefit: Significant reputation gain with all Iron-Bane

StateDescriptions.Neutral: No prior interaction or neutral standing. Standard rules apply.
StateDescriptions.Respected: Proper Veil-Speech demonstrated. +1d10 bonus on future checks.
StateDescriptions.Offended: Direct truth told. -2d10 penalty on future checks until amends made.
StateDescriptions.DeepOffense: Repeated offense. -4d10 penalty, interaction may be blocked.

Offended: A gift or favor appropriate to the offense
Sufficient time for the offense to be forgotten
DeepOffense: Intervention by a respected third party
Completion of a quest or significant favor
Some NPCs may never forgive this level of offense

Minor.Recovery: Automatic after one successful interaction, or a brief apology

Moderate.Recovery: Requires explicit acknowledgment of error and a small gesture of respect

Severe.Recovery: Requires substantial gift, formal apology before witnesses, or completing a task

Unforgivable.Recovery: Generally impossible. May require extraordinary measures such as completing a major quest.

IronBane.WorstApproach: Appearing weak or breaking sworn oaths
